revised_title: The Connought Worm: A Study of its Characteristics and Potential Poisonous Properties
tldr: The author presents a detailed description of the Connought Worm, a large caterpillar-like creature reported to be the only poisonous animal in Ireland. He discusses various observations and experiments conducted on the creature, including its physical characteristics, behavior, and potential toxicity. The author also examines the beliefs and folklore surrounding the Connought Worm and its supposed poisonous properties.
